page.title: 20EAST COKER STREET FAYRE
page.content: The village hall was the centre of activity when villagers held their {Street Fayre}to celebrate the 300th Anniversary of the{Pitchfork {Rebellion. { 17th century costume}and pitchforks were in evidence among the stall holders who lined the street and those serving teas in the hall.The scene was {lively.}A{steam engine}provided the music for a children's{roundabout.}You could try moth-ball bashing or ride in style in a vintage Rolls Royce. Tombola tickets were on sale beside the "vintage" cider and wine tasting. W.I. "fairings"provided tasty fillers whilst browsing among the bric-a-brac. Yet less than a mile away,by the church,an old lady sat in peace on the village green. And that is the nature of the village as found by The Park School,Yeovil.
